#Text=Government Camp
#Text=Government Camp is a city in Oregon .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Government Camp is a small community located on the shoulder of Mount Hood in the Mount Hood national forest .
#Text=Mt Hood 's alpine village was established in 1849 when a mounted Cavalry division was forced to abandon wagons , equipment and draft animals , because heavy snows made conditions impassable .
#Text=The town was from then on referred to as " government camp " by subsequent emigrants crossing the cascades into the Willamette Valley .

column1: #Text=Now the town is a destination for recreation and out door activities , best known as the summer time hub for alpine skiing .
#Text=The local ski area boasts the longest season in North America with 400+ inches of snow year on top of a glacier , lifts are open through September .
#Text=Get in
#Text=An hours drive from Portland .
#Text=Take I-84 east to exit 16 , turn right off the exit and follow road to the intersection of hwy 26 .
#Text=Turn left on 26 and continue for 40 miles .
#Text=The turn off for government camp is the loop road on your left at the flashing light .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Government Camp is a small community .
#Text=Walking is the best mode of transportation in town .
#Text=There is a shuttle service in the winter that serves Ski Bowl and Timberline , offering transportation between both ski areas and into town .
#Text=Raz transportation offers bus service in the winter from Portland to Mt Hood Meadows ski area .
#Text=See
#Text=The Government Camp cultural museum , on the east side of town on the loop road has a exhibits and information about the history of the community .
#Text=The Oregon Trail interpretative center kiosk is directly across the street and has historical information about the first people to come across the pass via the Barlow trail .
#Text=Do
#Text=In the winter
#Text=there are plenty of snow related activities near by .
#Text=You can ski from Timberline lodge 4+ miles into town via the glade or alpine trails .

#Text=There is a shuttle service that runs in the winter to get you back to the top , or hitching a ride from the many travelers on there way up to timberline lodge is also a popular mode of transport .
#Text=There are 4 ski areas that are in the vicinity .
#Text=Timberline , Ski Bowl , Mt Hood Meadows , Summit .
#Text=Summer offers many opportunities for hiking and camping .
#Text=The Pacific Ridge trail comes through town , going north to Canada and south to Mexico .
#Text=The local trails connect to a network of trails that cover the entire mountain including the 40 mile loop that stretches around the mountain at the 4000/6000ft level .
#Text=Mt . Hood Adventure Park at Skibowl .
#Text=- located in Government Camp
#Text=Buy
#Text=There are a few ski shops in town .
#Text=Vallians , Mountain Tracks
#Text=Eat
#Text=Charlie 's Mountain View .
#Text=The Ratskeller , Ice Axe grill , Huckleberry Inn , The Taco Shoppe
#Text=Drink
#Text=Charlies , Ratskeller , Beer Stube @
#Text=Ski Bowl , Brewery
#Text=Charlies Mountain View , Government Camp loop road .
#Text=Charlie 's is great road house/ ski bar in the center of town .
#Text=There is also a restaurant .
#Text=Drinks are cheap and there is a lot of local buzz .
